Package tests.sic.sST.norm

tests.sic.sST.norm package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing normally distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    FET2
    auxiliary class not part of the public API.
    ssPlusDTCnormBoxed
    the class works as the class sSTCnormBoxed but the arguments are s, D (representing the difference S-s) and T, which allows for specifying the constraints 0 ≤ D ≤ Dmax directly on any meta-heuristic optimizing the function sSTCnorm.
    sSTCnorm
    function implements the continuous-time long-run expected cost of a periodic review, single echelon inventory control system facing exogenous demands generated in a period of length T, from a normal process with parameters N(μ T, σ2T) with μ,σ>0.
    sSTCnorm.FH
    private auxiliary inner class NOT part of the public API.
    sSTCnorm.FInner2
    private auxiliary inner class NOT part of the public API.
    sSTCnorm.FInner3
    private auxiliary inner class NOT part of the public API.
    sSTCnormBoxed
    the class extends the sSTCnorm class with the functionality that it projects any argument for evaluation into the feasible region of the class.
    sSTCnormFastHeur2Opt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under normal demands, by computing near-optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* according to the heuristic implemented in class tests.sic.rnqt.norm.RnQTCnormHeurOpt and then computing the best (s(r*),S(r*+Q*)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCnormFastHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under normal demands, by computing near-optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* according to the heuristic implemented in class tests.sic.rnqt.norm.RnQTCnormHeurOpt and then computing the optimal (s(t),S(t)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCnormFixedTBCOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 4 double values.
    sSTCnormFixedTBCOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of optimizing an sSTCnorm function, with a fixed review period T.
    sSTCnormFixedTBoxedConstrOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s and the order-up-to S variables, for given (fixed) review period T, subject to the constraints S ≥ s, s ∈ [smin, smax], and S ∈ [Smin, Smax], using an exhaustive search on both variables with step size εs.
    sSTCnormFixedTOpt
    class implements an optimizer over the first two variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s and the order-up-to S variables, for given (fixed) review period T.
    sSTCnormFixedTOpterResult
    auxiliary class that is essentially just an immutable struct, holding 5 double values.
    sSTCnormFixedTOptTask
    auxiliary class encapsulating the notion of optimizing an sSTCnorm function, with a fixed review period T.
    sSTCnormHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under normal demands, by computing the optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* -which is usually done much faster- and then computing the optimal (s(t),S(t)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.
    sSTCnormMetaHeurOpt
    class uses any of the following supported meta-heuristics for (s,S,T) policy optimization under normal demands: GA, SA, PS, DE.
    sSTCnormOpt
    class implements an optimizer over ALL three variables of the (s,S,T) policy, namely the reorder point s the order-up-to S and the review period T.
    sSTCnormSimpleHeurOpt
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under normal demands, by computing the optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* using the algorithm implemented in class tests.sic.rnqt.norm.RnQTCnormOpt and then setting s=r*, S=r*+Q* and T=T*.

Package tests.sic.sST.norm Description

tests.sic.sST.norm package: implements exact and/or heuristic algorithms for the global optimization of long-run expected average costs of a single-echelon inventory control system operating a periodic review control policy (s,S,T) facing normally distributed demands in a continuous time cost-accounting setting.

Package Specification

The formulae for the average cost of such a system are taken from the classic IE textbook of Hadley and Whitin, "Analysis of Inventory Systems", 1963.
